name: Name and Territory of India
description: India, that is Bharat, shall be a Union of States.

name: Formation of New States
description: Parliament can form new states or change boundaries of existing states.

name: Definition of the State
description: Defines 'State' to include government, Parliament, state legislatures, and local authorities.

name: Laws Inconsistent with fundamental-rights
description: Any law violating fundamental-rights is void.

name: Right to Equality
description: Guarantees equality before the law and equal protection of laws.

name: Prohibition of Discrimination
description: Prohibits discrimination based on religion, race, caste, sex, or place of birth.

name: Equality of Opportunity
description: Equal job opportunity in public employment.

name: Abolition of Untouchability
description: Untouchability is abolished and its practice is punishable.

name: Abolition of Titles
description: State shall not confer titles except military or academic distinctions.

name: Six Freedom Rights
description: Freedom of speech, assembly, movement, residence, profession, and forming associations.

name: Protection in Conviction for Offences
description: No double punishment, no retrospective criminal laws, no self-incrimination.

name: Right to Life and Personal Liberty
description: No one can be deprived of life or liberty except according to procedure established by law.

name: Right to Education
description: Free and compulsory education for children aged 6 to 14.

name: Protection Against Arrest
description: Rights during arrest and detention, including legal representation and being informed of grounds.

name: Prohibition of Human Trafficking
description: Prohibits trafficking, begar, and forced labour.

name: Prohibition of Child Labour
description: Children under 14 cannot be employed in factories or hazardous places.

name: Freedom of Conscience & Religion
description: Freedom to practice, profess, and propagate religion.

name: Religious Affairs
description: Freedom to manage religious institutions.

name: No Tax for Religion
description: No person shall be forced to pay taxes for promoting any religion.

name: No Religious Instruction in Govt Institutions
description: Religious teaching is banned in fully government-run schools.

name: Protection of Culture
description: Minorities can conserve their language, script, and culture.

name: Right of Minorities
description: Minorities can run their own educational institutions.

name: Right to Constitutional Remedies
description: Right to move the Supreme Court to protect fundamental-rights (Heart and Soul of Constitution).

name: Fundamental Duties
description: Lists 11 duties of every Indian citizen, including respecting the Constitution and promoting harmony.
